review: game was fun and engaging until about 54 and then just got annoying  i dont like having to make pixel perfect platform jumps and i dont like having to make two characters jump at the exact same time to pass a stage

thomas was alone is an enjoyable simple platformer game i beat the game and got all achievements in a little over 5 hours i then didnt touch it for years but decided to replay it and i really enjoy the little story and the music for the game i dont remember how much i paid for it but i do remember it wasnt very expensive and so long as you believe the price is fair for a little over 5 hours of content and you like platforming games i think youd find it to be worth the price

h1blocks with personalityh1  thomas was alone is a simple yet very enjoyable puzzle game the controls are easy to learn and the levels are short but fun what really makes it stand out is the storytelling and how each little shape has its own personality the narrator does a great job of making you care about these blocks  its not a long game but its charming and creative from start to finish if you like short puzzle games with heart this one is definitely worth playing
these colourful blobs have become my family

other than the weird audio bug where music can sometimes overlap this game is a perfect mix of deep story and challenging platforming while the characters are displayed as simple polygons the personality behind each individual one will be enough for the player to immerse themselves in this complex and interesting 2d universe i may be biased because i played this game when i was six but my nostalgia years later is hardly something that sways my opinion on this game
good music good game play excellent narration the game is criminally short and may not be worth full price but it is definitely worth it if you have 5 dollars to spare
